intro: Acnistus macrophyllus, commonly known as the giant flame vine, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and vibrant blooms. However, it is considered invasive in some regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread aggressively.
